item.title: Inflation remains elevated as Trump's tariffs take hold
item.description: Inflation remained elevated last month as President Trump's tariffs continued to make their way into the prices that consumers pay. The average cost of living in July was up 2.7%.

item.description: Rates of the world's deadliest cancer appear to be low in sub-Saharan Africa. But that statistic is masking the scope of the disease, doctors say.

item.title: Alaska was once a full-fledged Russian colony. Now it's hosting a U.S.-Russia summit
item.description: Russia lost a war in Crimea in the 1850s. To pay off war debts, Russia sold Alaska to the U.S. Now presidents Trump and Putin will meet Friday in Alaska to discuss another war involving Crimea.

item.title: In Alabama, a dredging project in Mobile Bay brings together unlikely allies
item.description: Dredging waterways for navigation is a centuries-old practice, but this project is controversial because the mud being dug out of the channel is put into other parts of Mobile Bay.
